Cache Config

Configuration selection for the cache.

These macros may be used in conjunction with the am_hal_cachectrl_cache_config() function to select the cache type.

enum  am_hal_cachectrl_descr_e {
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_512E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W1_128B_512E ,
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_2WAY_128B_512E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W2_128B_512E ,
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_1024E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W1_128B_1024E ,
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_512E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W1_128B_512E ,
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_2WAY_128B_512E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W2_128B_512E ,
  AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_1024E = CACHECTRL_CACHECFG_CONFIG_W1_128B_1024E
}

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_descr_e

enum am_hal_cachectrl_descr_e

Cache description type, where:

  • nWay = number of ways (associativity)
  • 128B = 128 bits linesize
  • 512E = 512 entries,
  • 1024E = 1024 entries
Enumerator
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_512E 
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_2WAY_128B_512E 
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_1024E 
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_512E 
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_2WAY_128B_512E 
AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_DESCR_1WAY_128B_1024E

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_config()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_config ( const am_hal_cachectrl_config_t *  psConfig)

Configure the cache using the supplied settings.

Parameters
psConfig- pointer to a config structure containing cache settings.

This function takes in a structure of cache settings and uses them to configure the cache. This function will configures all of the settings in the structure as well as recommended settings for various other cache configuration parameters.

Note
This function does NOT enable the cache, which is handled in a separate function. In fact, if the cache is enabled prior to calling this function, it will return from the call disabled.
Note
For most applications, the default cache settings will be the most efficient choice. To use the default cache settings with this function, use the address of the global am_hal_cachectrl_defaults structure as the psConfig argument.
Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_control()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_control ( am_hal_cachectrl_control_e  eControl,
void *  pArgs 
)

Assert various specific controls on the cache.

This function is used to apply various controls on the cache.

Parameters
eControl- One of the following:
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH_CACHE_INVALIDATE
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_STATISTICS_RESET
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH_ALL_SLEEP_ENABLE,
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH_ALL_SLEEP_DISABLE,
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH0_SLEEP_ENABLE
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH0_SLEEP_DISABLE
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH1_SLEEP_ENABLE
  • AM_HAL_CACHECTRL_CONTROL_FLASH1_SLEEP_DISABLE
pArgs- pointer to args structure
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_disable ( void  )

Disable the cache.

Use this function to disable cache. Other configuration settings are not not required.

Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_enable ( void  )

Enable the cache.

Enable the cache for operation.

Returns
Status.

◆ am_hal_cachectrl_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_cachectrl_status_get ( am_hal_cachectrl_status_t *  psStatus)

Cache controller status function.

This function returns the current status of the cache.

Parameters
psStatus- ptr to a status structure to receive the current statuses.
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
